alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk; Greenwood; Montgomery; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 26 at 11:02PM CST until February 27 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Elk County in southeastern Kansas... Wilson County in southeastern Kansas... Montgomery County in southeastern Kansas... Chautauqua County in southeastern Kansas... Woodson County in southeastern Kansas... Southern Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... * Until midnight CST. * At 1102 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Eureka to near Howard to near Cedar Vale, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Eureka, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Yates Center, Sedan, Howard, Dearing, Altoona, Moline, Longton, Elk City, Toronto, Severy, Buffalo, Tyro and Fall River. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Chautauqua; Elk; Greenwood; Montgomery; Wilson; Woodson
